title: 108_hr482
content:
The "Florida National Forest Land Management Act of 2003" defines terms like "Secretary" as the Secretary of Agriculture and "State" as the State of Florida. It also addresses the sale or exchange of land. The Secretary has the authority to sell or exchange parcels of Federal land in Florida, including specific tracts in Santa Rosa and Okaloosa Counties. The Secretary has the authority to sell or exchange parcels of Federal land in Florida, including specific tracts in Santa Rosa and Okaloosa Counties. Tracts in Okaloosa County include various parcels such as Mooney Road, Crestview, Okaloosa County Fairgrounds, City Ball Park, and Landfill-Golf Course Driving Range. The curr_chunk describes several tracts of land in Florida, including parcels in Okaloosa, Liberty, and Lake Counties. These tracts range in size from 0.5 acres to 40.85 acres and are located in various sections within each county. The curr_chunk describes various tracts of land in Lake County, Florida, ranging from approximately 39.99 acres to 127.2 acres. The tracts are located in different sections within the county. The curr_chunk describes tracts of land in Marion County, Florida, totaling approximately 30 acres and 15 acres. The Secretary has the authority to modify land descriptions for sale or exchange purposes based on a survey. The Secretary has the authority to modify land descriptions for sale or exchange based on a survey or in the best interest of the public. Offers for the sale or exchange of land can be solicited, with the Secretary having the discretion to reject offers that are deemed inadequate or not in the public interest. The land described in subsection (b) can be sold at public or private sale, including auctions, as determined appropriate by the Secretary. The Secretary may use a real estate broker and pay them a commission for land sales or exchanges. The Secretary of the Air Force must approve the sale or exchange of certain land parcels. Cash equalization payments exceeding 25% of the Federal land value may be accepted in exchanges. The net proceeds from land sales or exchanges under this Act are deposited in the Sisk Act fund for the Secretary to use for land acquisition and reimbursement of costs incurred. SEC. 4. ADMINISTRATION.

Land acquired by the United States under this Act shall be subject to the Weeks Act and administered according to laws applicable to the National Forest System. The land described in section 3(b) is withdrawn from public land laws, mining laws, and mineral leasing laws.
